definitions.definition: a piece of metal, wood, rubber, etc. with a pointed edge at one end and a wide edge at the other, either pushed between two objects to keep them still or forced into something to break pieces off it:
examples: Push a wedge under the door to keep it open while we're carrying the boxes in.

definitions.definition: a piece of something, especially food, in the shape of a triangle:
examples: Auntie Ann put a huge wedge of cake on my plate.

definitions.definition: to make something stay in a particular position by using a wedge:
examples: [ + adj ] Find something to wedge the window open/closed with.

definitions.definition: to put something into a very small or narrow space, so that it cannot move easily:
examples: Her shoe came off and got wedged between the bars.
